Job Description:
We are looking for a proven Business Intelligence Analyst to join our BI Team. The Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for the design, implementation & support of our data systems. You will be working closely with business users, the data infrastructure team, and data analysts to support the ongoing development of enterprise-wide BI platform. You'll be designing and implementing architecture, tools, and processes needed to provide "single source of truth" reports to support data-driven decision making.


The ideal candidate will be a skilled developer who is passionate about business intelligence, comfortable working in an agile environment and embraces the opportunity to connect with customers to define and shape our solutions.

What you'll do
Lead requirements gathering sessions, analyze requirements, design and develop analytical projects working together with users finding the best possible solution to a given business problem
Contribute to data aggregation strategy for reporting, dashboards, and self-service analytics
Build relationships with key business partners
Build highly customized reports and develop creative solutions to apply business logic
Document new and existing models, solutions, and implementations.
Ensure that collected data is within required quality standards
Train and assist users to transform data into action-oriented information and to use that information
Architect Tableau projects from end to end; Lead root cause analysis efforts for operational Tableau issues; resolve them independently or with other team members
Support business users answering complex business questions via Tableau and using ad-hoc SQL queries
About you
Ability to lead your projects - identifying user requirements to writing ETL scripts to aggregate the data to craft dashboards/reports
5-7 years of experience as a data analyst/developer
2-4 years of experience in Tableau reporting platform.
Advanced SQL skills and experience writing complex queries
Advanced data visualization skills, show the ability to tell stories and make dashboards actionable
Performance tuning and troubleshooting experience
Understanding of Tableau solution infrastructure and knowledge
Experience working directly with business users to build reports, dashboards and solving business questions with data
BS/BA, in Computer Science area, MS in Computer Science is a plus
Experience with marketplaces, logistics, or economics is a plus
About us

Founded in 2013, DoorDash is a San Francisco-based technology company passionate about transforming local businesses and dedicated to enabling new ways of working, earning, and living. Today, DoorDash connects customers with their favorite local and national restaurants in more than 1,000 cities across the United States and Canada. By building intelligent, last-mile delivery technology for local cities, DoorDash aims to connect people with the things they care about — one dash at a time.

About Pantheon

Pantheon is the only WebOps platform built from the ground up for agility. We help our customers win, where digital experience starts and matters most - their websites. We empower teams of developers, marketers, and IT professionals to focus on delivering business results while Pantheon handles uptime, performance, scalability and security. We are the fastest growing Drupal and WordPress platform in the world, powering over 200,000 sites and serving billions of pages every month. Happy customers include some of the most recognized names in high tech, higher education and NGO, such as Patch, Apigee, UC Berkeley, Arizona State University, and the United Nations.

With 35% of the web running open source, we are growing aggressively into a huge market opportunity and looking to expand our product team. That's where you come in.

The Role

As a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, you will make an immediate impact as a founding member of this team. You will help transform Pantheon into a data driven company by bringing your advanced analytics experience to the organization. You will partner closely with stakeholders across all departments to understand their business challenges, develop hypotheses, and improve decision making with data driven thinking.

Pantheon's core values are Trust, Teamwork, Passion, and Customers First. At Pantheon, we value individuality, humor, and balance. We're enthusiastic participants in several open-source communities and have real relationships with many of our most active customers. If all of this sounds interesting to you, read on!

Cool Stuff You'll Do
Be a strategic voice in the development of transformative insights about our business drivers and customer base
Work with leaders across the entire organization to provide critical intelligence that drives business changing decisions
Build all-new prescriptive and predictive models using our analytics suite by asking smart questions and leveraging your analytical experience and SQL skills to provide answers
Empower business users to make better and more impactful, data-driven decisions by coaching and mentoring their collective understanding and usage of BI tools.
Interface with the data engineering and product team to enhance the business intelligence and analytics experience of team members across the company.
What You Bring To The Table
5+ years experience in business intelligence, insights, data analytics or related roles with hands-on experience working in BI and data visualization tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, Data Studio)
Proven experience building relationships and managing stakeholder data and analytics requirements
Effective ability to directly translate EDW data into answers for business stakeholders and work with data engineers to enhance the EDW data set
Advanced SQL skills applied on relational databases such as MySQL, PostGres, and BigQuery.
Capacity to work successfully in a fast-paced, start­up environment
BA/BS degree
Bonus Points For
Experience in Python
LookML development experience in Looker
What We Offer
Fantastic work environment powered by an amazing team
Unlimited vacation
Dog-friendly office (HQ)
Maternity and paternity leave
Monthly gym and book allowance
Fun at WordPress and Drupal community events
Fully loaded kitchen and daily catered lunches (HQ, NY, MN)
Discounts on custom bicycles (the founders of Pantheon also founded Mission Bicycle)

Pantheon is one of America's Best Workplaces of 2018 <link>
Pantheon earns Top 10 Ranking in "Best Software Awards" by G2 Crowd <link>
Pantheon actively sponsors programs like the Grace Hopper Celebration (GHC 19) <link>

At UCSF Health, our mission of innovative patient care, advanced technology and pioneering research is redefining what’s possible for the patients we serve – a promise we share with the professionals who make up our team.

Ranked by U.S. News & World Report as seventh in the country – UCSF Health is committed to providing the most rewarding work experience while delivering the best care available anywhere. In an environment that allows for continuous learning and opportunities for professional growth, UCSF Health offers the ideal atmosphere in which to best use your skills and talents.
Department Description
UCSF Health brings clinical and research service capabilities into a unified structure and single operating unit, achieving strategic, operational and financial alignment between the School of Medicine, Medical Group, and the Medical Center, as well as provider affiliates.

Its structure streamlines decision making, strengthens the ability to act with one voice, and ensures accountability at every point to execute collectively agreed upon commitment to excellence and efficiency.

UCSF Health’s 2020 vision is to provide innovative, high-quality, cost-competitive clinical services, and deliver an unparalleled patient experience across the entire care continuum.
Job Summary
The Value Improvement program was initiated to identify and deliver process improvements and efficiency savings. The Business Intelligence Analyst brings deep analytic skills to bear on largely unexplored or misunderstood financial and operational data to develop insights on where and how to focus organizational or departmental improvement efforts.

The analyst uses advanced knowledge of financial and clinical systems and industry practices to turn generalized opportunities into specific tactics to support operational efficiencies and strategic planning, and advises operational leaders and their teams on how to connect cost (and related savings) to the work performed. Analyst will work to develop strong linkages between input costs, improvement work and return on investment (ROI). Analyst will be a critical part of a team that may consist of physicians and other healthcare providers, and department leaders or process owners within IT, finance, and operations.

Responsibilities will include gathering data and producing highly complex and unique analyses / investigations of performance, utilization, clinical programs, market trends, and financial analyses in support of due diligence, billing and collection of revenue, and tracking of performance. Analyzes, evaluates and troubleshoots highly complex schedules and data for data errors and problems, designing, testing and applying advanced functional solutions.

The analyst is responsible for reporting and accountability of performance initiatives. Ensures details comply with finance policies and procedures. Gathers data and information from the managerial financial reporting system, the EPSi budget advisor system, and other applications to integrate overall financial performance at a cost center, division and other hierarchical levels. Provides for the measurement and benchmarking of business operations in relation to best business practices for the healthcare industry and internal business objectives, developing and presenting quantitative business cases to operational leaders and their teams.

Develops and maintains key relationships with organizational functional areas to meet the organization’s needs for effective system-wide financial ad hoc analyses. Applies extensive knowledge of industry practices in healthcare decision support and advanced professional concepts to substantial projects, typically at high degrees of complexity.

The successful candidate will work closely with physicians, leadership, medical center and faculty practice finance teams, decision support professionals, department managers, and outside consultants. The candidate must be able to thrive and succeed in a changing environment, and not be hindered by ambiguity or competing priorities.

An ability to take sparse information and successfully break down projects, initiatives and strategic priorities is expected. Maturity, high judgment, negotiation.
Required Qualifications
Five to seven years of healthcare decision support or financial analysis experience
Bachelor’s degree in Finance or related field with or equivalent combination of education and experience
Ability to independently gather relevant data from stakeholder groups, perform statistical analyses, and organize into models that support budgeting and forecasting
In-depth understanding of decision support systems, with knowledge of business statistics, quantitative methods, relational databases, business development scorecards, data modeling, and performance and profitability analysis
In-depth knowledge of issues and aspects of clinical finance, planning, financial data management, budget development and business development; proficiency in utilizing the tools to produce comprehensive, studies and actionable intelligence
In-depth ability to work with senior staff and managers across departments, serving as a technical leader and information resource in decision support, and providing recommendations and advice on decision support processes, business and financial issues
Advanced organizational and project management skills, and ability to lead a team, prioritize tasks, and see projects through from inception to completion on schedule
Advanced interpersonal skills, with the ability to lead projects and teams and collaborate productively on highly-complex projects with key personnel at all professional and technical levels
Advanced written and verbal communications skills, with the ability to interpret and convey highly sophisticated technical and financial information in a clear, concise manner, and to make cogent presentations of analyses, reports, and investigation results
Advanced problem-solving skills analytical ability, and in-depth knowledge of documentation and reporting, with the ability to run highly complex queries and studies, to collect and analyze financial and performance data, and to produce relevant, meaningful reports, analyses, and forecasts
Experience performing complex data analysis and transformation utilizing various iterations of SQL with tools such as Excel, MS-Access, MS SQL, or SAS
Understanding of variation and able to apply statistical tools to large data sets to uncover anomalies
Skills in project management and process re-design / re-engineering
Demonstrated ability to achieve results I a virtual and matrixed team environment
Self-motivated, results-oriented, demonstrating strong initiative
Ability to work under time constraints, meeting deadlines and schedule
Flexible and have a positive attitude and a sense of humor is highly desirable
The flexibility to orient and work at all UCSF Medical Center locations

Master’s degree in statistics, public health, or related field
Experience working with patient financial data in an acute hospital setting. Exposure to analysis at both the summary and detail level
Experience using EPSi or another hospital decision support software application is desirable, as is having worked in an EPIC health records environment
Experience with health care facility cost accounting and/or billing systems with a high-level understanding of where they do and do not integrate well with medical records
Experience at an academic medical center
Experience with commonly-used healthcare data sources (e.g., UHC’s CDB/RM or ODB/Action OI databases, Sg2, etc.)

About Us:


Mercari is the selling app. We make it super easy to sell (or buy) almost anything. We all have things we don't use, never used or simply outgrew. But that stuff still has value. Mercari gives you the power to simply sell it, ship it, and earn some cash for it. Fashion to toys. Sporting goods to electronics. All the brands you know and love. Our mission is simple: to make selling easier than buying. And with 45M+ downloads in the U.S. and 150k new listings every day, we're just getting started.

Mercari has over 100 million installs and millions of active users creating billions of data events that we need to turn into actionable insights. Our insights will help drive product improvement, efficient customer acquisition, user retention, a more efficient marketplace, a safe community of buyers and sellers, and overall monitoring of business performance. From data collection, normalization across platforms, analysis, and institutionalizing reporting measurements and dimensions, and data visualization, this is an opportunity to go deep on the full data stack to accelerate Mercari's growth.

Bachelor's Degree in Business, Business Intelligence or related field required

DESCRIPTION:

Division Overview:

The Business Intelligence team at CBS Interactive works in partnership with business stakeholders, providing actionable insight and recommendations about site and content performance in order to drive user growth, engagement and revenue opportunities. This position will focus primarily on CBS Interactives Tech, Gaming and Entertainment properties, including CNET, ZDNet, Techrepublic, TVGuide and GameSpot among others.

Role Details:

We are in search of a Business Intelligence Analyst who can partner with stakeholders focusing on forecasting and building projections on audience growth across our CNET Media Group properties. The Analyst needs to be comfortable gathering requirements, working with large datasets, querying against multiple databases and/or off-the-shelf analytics packages to arrive at insightful recommendations that will be used to drive KPIs and the budgeting process. In addition, the Analyst needs to be comfortable presenting and defending his/her recommendations at various levels within the organization.

The Analyst will also partner closely with Editorial staff and Finance to ensure reporting needs are met, that projections are validated and revenue optimizations are executed as planned. The Analyst should be proactive in identifying opportunities for analysis and optimization. In addition, the business intelligence Analyst should also be able to understand trends and identify their impact to the business in order to forecast future site and user performance. This position reports to the Senior Director in the Business Intelligence Group.

Your Day-to-Day:
Create, maintain and improve forecasting models
Manage reporting requests from start to finish
Investigate site issues, explain traffic patterns, understand and articulate user behavior
Clearly present findings and recommendations to decision makers at various levels
Proactively work on initiatives to drive the business forward
Lead data-driven analysis projects to help stakeholders make decisions that drive growth of the business

Experience with Adobe Site Catalyst/Omniture
Thorough understanding of data modeling and relational databases

High degree of initiative and ability to learn and very enthusiastic about data

Ability to work quickly and accurately on multiple projects concurrently
Ability to build strong working relationships with cross-functional teams

Job Title: Customer Success Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst
Job Description:
Box is growing fast - real fast - and we're just getting started. Our opportunity is meaningful: 500 million knowledge workers worldwide, struggling to manage, share and secure information trapped in $45 billion of legacy, disconnected systems. Box's mission is to power how the world works together. Over the past 10+ years, we have completely redefined the way people work together, becoming the market leader in cloud content management. What will the next 10 years look like? Join us and help build it.

Are you excited by the prospect of using analytics to drive business growth and customer retention? Do you possess exceptional business smarts, and are passionate about Big Data? Do you want to work in a challenging but fun environment, in an entrepreneurial but well-resourced and supportive environment? We are looking for a super smart and passionate individual to join our Business Analytics team. In this role, you will own the relationship with senior leaders across Customer Success and Renewals, driving analytical insight into business recommendations and actions.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

You will use analytics to drive business decisions, with the goal of strengthening customer retention, improving product adoption, and increasing renewal rates.
You will test your recommendations in a hypothesis-driven, data-tested manner. This includes 1) performing analytical deep-dives to identify problems, opportunities and actions required; 2) leveraging large amounts of disparate data sources by using SQL or other scripting and statistical tools, and 3) designing and managing test/pilot programs.
You will report against your initiatives by identifying key metrics and building executive-facing dashboards to track business progress and assess core initiatives.
You will serve as the thought partner for senior executives to translate insights into actions and business priorities.
WHO WE'RE LOOKING FOR

You're a "business thought partner", not just a "data monkey". Your analytical kung fu is strong, but what you really enjoy is finding ways to improve the business. It just so happens that you use data analytics as the tool to prove that your suggestions are the right ones.
Your analytics skills are strong, including 2+ years of experience in an analytics role. You have significant experience with SQL or experience in a major software engineering language (Python, C++, Java) or statistical packages (Alteryx, Matlab, SAS, R). Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, Looker, Domo, etc.) would be helpful. Experience with applied machine learning, data science, and/or statistics a plus.
Your business judgment is strong. You've got work experience in Sales or Customer Success, and you've got the ability to take ambiguous business problems and solve them in a structured, hypothesis-driven, data-supported way.
You've proven yourself as a trusted business partner. You've got exceptional business and communication skills. Strategy consulting experience or other client-facing professional services experience is a strong plus.

We are in search of a Business Intelligence Analyst who can partner with stakeholders focusing on forecasting and building projections on audience growth across our CNET Media Group properties. Mercer Advisors is a fee-only, independent RIA whose purpose is helping our clients achieve Economic Freedom. Established in 1985 as one of the nation’s first fee-only financial planning firms, we have a rich legacy of operating exclusively as a fiduciary. Unique to many RIAs we offer a full-suite of services all in house for our clients including investment management, financial planning, estate planning (in-house attorneys), tax planning and preparation (on staff CPAs) and trustee services. We are looking for talented, motivated people like you who can add to the growth of our business and culture.

Job Summary

The Business Intelligence Analyst is an integral part of the Strategy & Business Intelligence team, the group responsible for informing strategic action and efficient business processes across the company. Senior Leadership, Sales, Marketing, Operations, and Finance organizations rely on this group to report on the operational activity and performance of the organization – from the client account level up to aggregated business-level results. We are open to hiring this position to work out of our San Francisco or Denver office.

The Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for researching, collecting, analyzing and reporting operational and business data from multiple sources. This position provides administrative and analytical support as needed to drive day-to-day efficiencies and decisions.

Ability to work as a team as well as effectively manage his or her own projects and areas of responsibility are critical to success in this role. Ideal for an individual who is analytically minded, and fluid in manipulating and reporting on business and operational data, but who has an interest in participating in and gaining experience in the decisions that have real impact on business results.

While not essential, experience in Financial Services and/or Technology fields would be very useful.

Examples of activity areas of an analyst at this level would include:
Creating a new report in Salesforce to enable Sales leadership to understand the status of prospect opportunities
On-going management of a monthly process to report on asset flows in and out of the business
Understanding the data needs of a strategic project and pulling data from different sources and assembling into a spreadsheet used by the project team
Partnering with business team members to identify needs, define requirements and create a dashboard in Tableau to help individual Financial Advisors review their results – and then updating that dashboard on a weekly basis
Researching and understanding differences in data definitions and filters influencing the results reported by 2 different systems, and why the results are different
Creating, implementing and monitoring a process to ensure that a data field in Salesforce is maintained and accurate

Cohesity is redefining data management from the ground up to solve a critical challenge facing businesses today: mass data fragmentation. Most enterprise data — backups, archives, file shares, object stores, and data used for test/dev and analytics — sits in fragmented infrastructure silos that make it hard to protect, expensive to manage, and difficult to analyze. Cohesity consolidates silos onto one web-scale platform, spanning on-premises, cloud, and the edge, and uniquely empowers organizations to run apps on that platform — making it easier than ever to back up and extract insights from data. We're a values-led company looking for great people who love challenges, are collaborative and curious, unafraid to try, and passionate about customer success.

Job Description:
As a BI Analyst, you will provide data and recommendations to the business. This will include identifying the data sources and developing visualization of that data to drive decisions and process improvements.
You will be responsible for developing operational reporting capabilities, working with partner teams on ad-hoc analyses, and providing strategic support to the executive team. You will also be responsible for developing standardized metrics and reporting for the organization that keeps us informed, and are the fingers on the pulse of our business.
The ideal candidate for this role will be highly motivated and will use their technical skills to quickly make an impact ensuring that our growth curve extends into 2019 and beyond.
Responsibilities:
Work closely with operations management and their teams to understand their information requirements from start to finish, including gathering and documenting requirements, pulling data and compiling data into presentable reports, dashboards and charts
Manage reporting requirements as project driven tasks with documented requirements, timelines and milestones

Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst @ FinTech Startup ($B+ valuation)
Job Description:
Opus is recruiting on behalf of an insurtech startup in Palo Alto ($B+ valuation in 2 yrs).

Interested parties please apply - min requirements: 1 yr+ work experience in business intelligence / analytics.

POSITION SUMMARY: BASIC FUNCTION

The primary responsibility of this role is the development of data analyses that lead to actionable insights for the purpose of deriving incremental business value. This position will require performing duties typical of a business data analyst and will work as part of the Information Technology team. This position will work closely with our Business Analysts and applications team to develop technical requirements and comprehensive solutions to extract and transform data from multiple source systems for business use. The position will present findings and recommendations to key stakeholders. Regular, predictable attendance is essential for satisfactory performance.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Data reporting; including the development of programs, methodologies and files for interpretation of data and the development of recommendations based on the findings.

Perform routine data analysis using various techniques (ex. statistical analysis, predictive modeling, data mining)

Provide support in applying technical and business process expertise through the collection and reporting of organizational metrics.

Identify business opportunities where problems can be solved with data

Data mining from multiple sources to create integrated views that can be used to drive decision making.

Communicate findings to appropriate stakeholders, including executive management, in easy to understand language in both verbal and written format.

Design, develop and maintain reports and visual dashboards.

Understand the reference and conceptual architecture of a data warehouse infrastructure

Actively monitor, analyze and report on data to business performance goals. Managing daily-weekly-monthly reporting to bring trends, challenges, and recommendations to management?s attention.

Create and maintain Microsoft Power BI dashboards; Help to produce ad hoc reports and routine monthly reporting with data interpretation, conveying information that can be used in decision making

Work with Business Analysts to provide technical guidance and design for project and data requests

Performs other duties as assigned.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES

Passion for leveraging and interpreting data to drive significant business impact

Critical thinking skills to recognize patterns and anomalies in data and arrive at new conclusions based upon findings

Effective communication skills both verbal and written to communicate complex findings and ideas in logical, easy to understand and actionable language.

Attention to detail and vigilant about drawing the correct conclusions

Ability to multitask and prioritize projects with conflicting deadlines.

A team player with the ability and desire to collaborate effectively with stakeholders

Proficient in SQL with the ability to write queries

Strong knowledge of Excel, pivot tables, charting and databases

Familiarity with Agile/SCRUM methodologies

Microsoft O365 (ex. SharePoint, OneDrive, Skype, Teams)Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, or similar knowledge required

Able to be highly confidential.

Able to work in a team environment.

Manages stress and/or fast-pace effectively.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE

High school diploma.

Bachelor?s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Finance, Computer Science or related field or equivalent work experience

Minimum 6 years of experience as an analyst supporting marketing functions and initiatives with 2-3 years in Business Intelligence and Analytics preferred

Knowledge of statistical tools like R, SAS, SPSS or Excel Add ins (Data Analysis/Solver) or similar is a plus

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Primarily sitting with some walking, standing, and bending.

Able to hear and speak into a telephone.

Close visual work on a computer terminal.

Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate any required computer keyboard, mouse, and other technical instruments.

Able to lift and carry up to 20 lbs.

Able to climb a ladder and work on a raised platform.

WORK CONDITIONS

Standard office; extensive daily usage of workstation or computer.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS

Must possess a current, valid state-issued driver?s license.

Job Title: Trust & Safety Business Intelligence Analyst, Fraud
Job Description:
Founded in 2012, Instacart is a leader in North American online groceries and one of the fastest growing companies in e-commerce. Instacart's same-day delivery and pickup services bring everyday essentials and fresh groceries to consumers in the U.S. and Canada in as fast as an hour. At Instacart, we believe that great people are the ingredients for success. We like to think that we are like a potluck, everyone brings something new, different and flavorful to the table. Our mix of thoughtful, inventive and neighborly employees work together to deliver our common goal, to make grocery shopping effortless, and give valuable time back to our customers. We believe that just as meals are best shared together, success is best shared together. If this excites you, then Instacart just might be the place for you. Welcome home.

We are seeking an organized, analytical, and highly motivated individual to join Instacart's Trust & Safety organization, focusing initially on fraud-related activity (Customer + Shopper). The team takes data-driven, customer-first approaches to identifying patterns fraudulent-related activity on the platform, while implementing effective countermeasures to prevent and mitigate at scale. The ideal candidate has a knack for uncovering unusual patterns and is passionate about investigating further to identify the origin of the issue. In this role, you will need to make critical & sensitive decisions quickly, while maintaining strong attention to detail and effectively communicating with various stakeholders (Business Development, Product, Engineering, Finance, Field Operations, etc). It's important to understand that you will be operating in a very dynamic environment which requires always having an eye towards improvement.

You will be responsible for architecting meaningful, easily-digestible, and actionable single 'sources of truth' and ad-hoc analyses related to our Trust & Safety org, with the ultimate goal of ensuring the highest level of quality of Safety, Security, Integrity, and Quality on the platform. You will be a driving force behind decisions related to our business, working with stakeholders across operations, product, engineering, and finance as we push to achieve our ambitious vision.

Want to learn more? Lettuce show you the way!

Your day to day…

The ideal candidate can leverage a combination of deep analytics skills and business acumen to identify, extract, and visualize opportunities across all areas of Trust & Safety, which can then be used to drive meaningful improvements across various segments of the company. Additionally, the ideal candidate possesses excellent time-management skills, the ability to communicate & present information effectively to business partners at all levels, and a deep-seeded passion for continuous improvement, data integrity, and scalable solutions.
Own data analysis and visualization as it relates to all areas of Trust & Safety; Fraud (customer + shopper), Platform Access, Critical escalations, etc, as well as the identification of potential root causes contributing to potential change(s) in metrics
Regularly communicate associated outcomes and insights to various stakeholders at all levels, including senior management to help guide strategic decisions for improvement
Develop dashboards, analytical frameworks, and detailed reporting models that provide reliable, easily-digestible insights to key stakeholders to help guide decisions around process, policy, systems, and service models
Develop a deep understanding of how each area of the business impacts the other, as well as the underlying correlations relating to key company metrics
Create automated reporting to ensure operations leaders are informed of variations and opportunities across geographies and teams
Analyze unstructured behavioral data to discover operational events and activities impacting fulfillment quality and customer, shopper, & retailer experience.
Fundamentally change the way our teams across North America think about exceptional performance and customer experiences through innovative, value-added data approaches and insights
Regularly collaborate with other analysts, subject matter experts, and decision makers to develop data-driven policies and models to improve overall fulfillment performance
What You Should Already Have
Minimum 4-7 years in an analytics, business intelligence/operations, investment banking, or related environment
Ability to write complex and performant queries in your dialect of SQL to extract data from our data warehouse (Hive or Presto experience a plus)
Experience with R, Python, and/or Julia (fluency in at least one language preferred)
Experience with analytical visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, D3.js or similar tools
Extremely strong verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to synthesize complex topics and create compelling narratives for various audiences.
Excellent teamwork skills and desire to help others learn
High level of accountability and ownership – driven and focused self-starter
Strategic mindset – ability to think ahead of where the company is at now
Understanding of A/B testing and other forms of statistical analysis using statistical packages similar to R, SAS, or Pandas
Bonus points:
Experience in a fraud or Trust & Safety-related field
Experience in advanced reporting tools such as R Shiny, Dash, or Bokeh
Advanced degree in statistics or other quantitative field
Data modeling, ETL and data pipeline development experience

Tech Blog
Instacart News

We are the world-positive lender. Our mission is to connect billions of dollars of capital to millions of homeowners that want to convert their outdated houses into modern, smart, energy-efficient homes. By unlocking access to numerous products that help people achieve a more sustainable lifestyle, we are revolutionizing the $350 billion+ home improvement industry. As such, we have become the financial ecosystem for mission-driven businesses who need fast and frictionless lending to empower their customers, and we help consumers save money with our modern lending technology.

As part of our world-positive initiative, we are also the official sponsor of GivePower – a foundation that uses solar energy and storage technologies to deliver the most essential community services to regions of the world that need it most.

If you have an unstoppable desire to make a meaningful impact on our planet and help mission-driven businesses and consumers achieve a more sustainable future, join us.

Competitive pay

Position Summary:

Loanpal is looking for a data enthusiast to join our small but mighty Business Intelligence team. Our BI Analysts are highly respected and strategic members of our team, and can expect high-level interaction with senior executives on a regular basis. We work closely with stakeholders and IT teams to turn data into critical, actionable information and insights that we use every day to make sound business decisions. We provide data that is accurate, congruent and reliable, and ensure the information is easily available to users for direct consumption or integration with other systems.

Are you excited by the opportunity to advocate for accurate, responsible use of data to drive critical business strategy and execution? Build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables you to identify and address opportunities to leverage company data to drive business solutions
Design and document dashboards, alerts, and reports either on a regular recurring basis or as needed
Provide design support for the development of business intelligence solutions
Aggregate and manipulate data required for analyses from a wide range of internal/ external data sources, structures, and platforms while ensuring data quality
Build scalable production systems for data collection, data transformation, feature extraction, model training, and scoring, using distributed software tools;
Standardize and implement solutions wherever possible to ensure that our BI capabilities grow in an efficient, scalable manner

3+ years’ experience

Outstanding verbal and written communication to both non-technical and executive audiences
Data-Visualization experience (D3.js, Javascript, Node.js)
Database management a plus
Degrees or certifications - Finance/Math degree preferred
Experience with AWS environments a plus

Overview


At Patelco our people before profits belief is deeply rooted in our purpose driven philosophy. It’s this higher standard that drives us to make a difference in people’s lives as every product and service is developed for the financial well-being of our members, not our bottom line. As a key contributor to the Business Intelligence team, this position partners closely with cross-functional departments including Finance, IT, Marketing and others to develop datasets, dashboards, and models that deliver meaningful insights to the business. This position will be instrumental in applying advanced analytical techniques to transform the way we look at and derive value from our data. You will be working alongside other talented people who address complex business challenges every day which has tangible impacts to the organization’s success and our mission. The ideal candidate for this role has excellent analytical and time-management skills, with the ability to communicate and present information to stakeholders at all levels of the business. Your attention to detail ensures that you’ll get the job done accurately while thriving in a fast-paced environment. You should apply for this position if you possess a passion for data, a drive to solve analytical questions and the initiative to develop new BI techniques that supports the organization in achieving our goals.

Responsibilities
Responsible for identifying BI reporting opportunities when addressing business challenges through the use of statistical models and visualizations.
Perform data exploration and analysis using all available resources such as Tableau, Alteryx, SQL, R and other BI platforms and databases.
Identify and interpret trends and patterns in datasets to isolate drivers and business behaviors.
Create visualizations and interactive solutions-focused reporting for enterprise distribution.
Conduct ongoing internal review of queries and reports built by business partners to identify process improvement that will increase operational efficiency.
Evaluate and plan activities to implement automation of data extracts and other manual activities to streamline report delivery and improve time to insight demands.
Provide user education of BI applications to assist in ensuring easy access to data with the goal of promoting self-service and reduce reliance on technical resources to solve business needs.
Mentor users across the organization to promote data education, technical best practices, and a data-driven culture in all aspects of the business.
Develop BI metadata and models for ad-hoc reporting, analysis and management dashboards.
Qualifications
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with a high degree of attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy.
Deep level of understanding of databases including relational and dimensional. Functions on an advanced level in multiple BI platforms, reporting systems, and tool sets.
Experience with statistical analysis including but not limited to data normalization, identifying distributions, z-scores, confidence intervals and probability.
Familiar with data mining techniques such as cluster analysis, decision trees, random forests or support vector machines.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with strong aptitude for problem solving.
Ability to work effectively in a fast paced environment, contribute independently and within a collaborative team oriented environment using sound judgment in decision-making.
Comfortable working under deadlines and performing multiple tasks effectively and concurrently.
Experience in handling structured and unstructured data from internal and third-party sources.
Aptitude to explain complex analytical concepts in a simple, easy to digest format for non-technical staff
Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or similar quantitative field of study.
5+ years working in business intelligence, analytics, data science or related experience.
Highly proficient with SQL, Tableau and R or Python programing languages.
Experience working in the financial services industry strongly preferred.

Pattern Energy Group is an independent, fully integrated energy company that develops, constructs, owns and operates renewable energy projects and transmission assets across North America, Japan, and parts of Latin America. The company focuses primarily on wind, solar and transmission. The Pattern Energy Group team has a history as one of the top North American renewable energy and transmission providers in the industry. The team is dedicated to delivering the highest value for its customers, partners, financial supporters and the communities in which it works, while exhibiting a strong commitment to promoting environmental stewardship and corporate responsibility.
Pattern Energy Group operates in the United States, Canada, Japan, and Mexico with offices in San Francisco, Houston, San Diego, New York, Tokyo, and Toronto. Pattern Energy Group’s corporate headquarters is in San Francisco.

Job Purpose
The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst will support the Financial Systems team and various other stakeholders across Pattern by designing and publishing reports, data analytics, and informational dashboards for both technical and non-technical end users. The candidate will proactively identify areas for new development or redevelopment of existing reporting functionality to create efficiencies in Pattern’s financial and operational activities. Responsible for working within a complex network of data sources and tools, thinking strategically about optimal methods for structuring and presenting data to end users, and putting strategy into action. Responsible for prioritizing and juggling many competing deliverables. The candidate will leverage extensive business intelligence experience with knowledge gained of the company to support business processes and reporting needs of the company.
Key Accountabilties
Partner with stakeholders including Accounting, Operations, Development, and other teams within Pattern to design, develop, and deliver robust and scalable reporting automation in PowerBI to gain insights from source systems such as Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations, XRM, Hyperion and other enterprise platforms.
Develop or redevelop reports, visualizations, workspaces and/or interactive Business Intelligence (BI) reports, tailored to various user groups across Pattern, transforming raw data into actionable insights for various stakeholders within Pattern.
Learn and understand data architecture in various source systems and data warehouses to enable report design.
Define reporting requirements and translate requirements into technical specifications.
Design, develop, and maintain automated, self-service systems/reports/dashboards at-scale.
Write efficient T-SQL queries against large, complex data sets.
Establish relationships and coordinate with Pattern technical experts in other business units and the Data Architect.
Support ad-hoc requests by developing optimized queries and data visualizations.
Perform other process improvement-related projects as assigned.

Experience/Qualifications/Education Required
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Accounting, or related quantitative/analytical field.
3-5 years relevant working experience in a business intelligence and/or data management role. Experience with Microsoft AX, Microsoft Dynamics 365, Hyperion, and/or Microsoft Power BI/SQL is highly preferred.
Advanced knowledge of Data Warehousing and BI best practices.
Excellent data analysis skills, including the ability to work with and profile large data sets while giving exceptional attention to detail/accuracy.
Ability to work effectively within a highly complex organization consisting of many legal entities and operational activities across diverse geographic regions.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with an ability to express ideas effectively through data or presentation.
Experience at a large, public company preferred.
Highly responsible, dependable and proactive with strong work ethic and the ability to work effectively independently and in a team environment.
Passion for renewable energy and supporting Pattern’s mission of transitioning the world to renewable energy.

Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Decision Support Services (BUS INTEL SPEC 4)
Job Description:
At UCSF Health, our mission of innovative patient care, advanced technology and pioneering research is redefining what’s possible for the patients we serve – a promise we share with the professionals who make up our team.

Ranked by U.S. News & World Report as seventh in the country – UCSF Health is committed to providing the most rewarding work experience while delivering the best care available anywhere. In an environment that allows for continuous learning and opportunities for professional growth, UCSF Health offers the ideal atmosphere in which to best use your skills and talents.
Department Description
UCSF Health brings clinical and research service capabilities into a unified structure and single operating unit, achieving strategic, operational and financial alignment between the School of Medicine, Medical Group, and the Medical Center, as well as provider affiliates.

Its structure streamlines decision making, strengthens the ability to act with one voice, and ensures accountability at every point to execute collectively agreed upon commitment to excellence and efficiency.

UCSF Health’s 2020 vision is to provide innovative, high-quality, cost-competitive clinical services, and deliver an unparalleled patient experience across the entire care continuum.
Job Summary
The Value Improvement program was initiated to identify and deliver process improvements and efficiency savings. The Business Intelligence Analyst brings deep analytic skills to bear on largely unexplored or misunderstood financial and operational data to develop insights on where and how to focus organizational or departmental improvement efforts.

The analyst uses advanced knowledge of financial and clinical systems and industry practices to turn generalized opportunities into specific tactics to support operational efficiencies and strategic planning, and advises operational leaders and their teams on how to connect cost (and related savings) to the work performed. Analyst will work to develop strong linkages between input costs, improvement work and return on investment (ROI). Analyst will be a critical part of a team that may consist of physicians and other healthcare providers, and department leaders or process owners within IT, finance, and operations.

Responsibilities will include gathering data and producing highly complex and unique analyses / investigations of performance, utilization, clinical programs, market trends, and financial analyses in support of due diligence, billing and collection of revenue, and tracking of performance. Analyzes, evaluates and troubleshoots highly complex schedules and data for data errors and problems, designing, testing and applying advanced functional solutions.

The analyst is responsible for reporting and accountability of performance initiatives. Ensures details comply with finance policies and procedures. Gathers data and information from the managerial financial reporting system, the EPSi budget advisor system, and other applications to integrate overall financial performance at a cost center, division and other hierarchical levels. Provides for the measurement and benchmarking of business operations in relation to best business practices for the healthcare industry and internal business objectives, developing and presenting quantitative business cases to operational leaders and their teams.

Develops and maintains key relationships with organizational functional areas to meet the organization’s needs for effective system-wide financial ad hoc analyses. Applies extensive knowledge of industry practices in healthcare decision support and advanced professional concepts to substantial projects, typically at high degrees of complexity.

The successful candidate will work closely with physicians, leadership, medical center and faculty practice finance teams, decision support professionals, department managers, and outside consultants. The candidate must be able to thrive and succeed in a changing environment, and not be hindered by ambiguity or competing priorities.

An ability to take sparse information and successfully break down projects, initiatives and strategic priorities is expected. Maturity, high judgment, negotiation.
Required Qualifications
Five to seven years of healthcare decision support or financial analysis experience
Bachelor’s degree in Finance or related field with or equivalent combination of education and experience
Ability to independently gather relevant data from stakeholder groups, perform statistical analyses, and organize into models that support budgeting and forecasting
In-depth understanding of decision support systems, with knowledge of business statistics, quantitative methods, relational databases, business development scorecards, data modeling, and performance and profitability analysis
In-depth knowledge of issues and aspects of clinical finance, planning, financial data management, budget development and business development; proficiency in utilizing the tools to produce comprehensive, studies and actionable intelligence
In-depth ability to work with senior staff and managers across departments, serving as a technical leader and information resource in decision support, and providing recommendations and advice on decision support processes, business and financial issues
Advanced organizational and project management skills, and ability to lead a team, prioritize tasks, and see projects through from inception to completion on schedule
Advanced interpersonal skills, with the ability to lead projects and teams and collaborate productively on highly-complex projects with key personnel at all professional and technical levels
Advanced written and verbal communications skills, with the ability to interpret and convey highly sophisticated technical and financial information in a clear, concise manner, and to make cogent presentations of analyses, reports, and investigation results
Advanced problem-solving skills analytical ability, and in-depth knowledge of documentation and reporting, with the ability to run highly complex queries and studies, to collect and analyze financial and performance data, and to produce relevant, meaningful reports, analyses, and forecasts
Experience performing complex data analysis and transformation utilizing various iterations of SQL with tools such as Excel, MS-Access, MS SQL, or SAS
Understanding of variation and able to apply statistical tools to large data sets to uncover anomalies
Skills in project management and process re-design / re-engineering
Demonstrated ability to achieve results I a virtual and matrixed team environment
Self-motivated, results-oriented, demonstrating strong initiative
Ability to work under time constraints, meeting deadlines and schedule
Flexible and have a positive attitude and a sense of humor is highly desirable
The flexibility to orient and work at all UCSF Medical Center locations
Preferred Qualifications
Master’s degree in statistics, public health, or related field
Experience working with patient financial data in an acute hospital setting. Exposure to analysis at both the summary and detail level
Experience using EPSi or another hospital decision support software application is desirable, as is having worked in an EPIC health records environment
Experience with health care facility cost accounting and/or billing systems with a high-level understanding of where they do and do not integrate well with medical records
Experience at an academic medical center
Experience with commonly-used healthcare data sources (e.g., UHC’s CDB/RM or ODB/Action OI databases, Sg2, etc.)
Licensure/Certification
N/A
Living Pride Standards
Service Excellence
Demonstrates service excellence by following the Everyday PRIDE Guide with the UCSF Medical Center standards and expectations for communication and behavior. These standards and expectations convey specific behavior associated with the Medical Center’s values: Professionalism, Respect, Integrity, Diversity and Excellence, and provide guidance on how we communicate with patients, visitors, faculty, staff, and students, virtually everyone, every day and with every encounter. These standards include, but are not limited to: personal appearance, acknowledging and greeting all patients and families, introductions using AIDET, managing up, service recovery, managing delays and expectations, phone standards, electronic communication, team work, cultural sensitivity and competency.
Uses effective communication skills with patients and staff; demonstrates proper telephone techniques and etiquette; acts as an escort to any patient or family member needing directions; shows sensitivity to differences of culture; demonstrates a positive and supportive manner in which patients / families/ colleagues perceive interactions as positive and supportive. Exhibits team work skills to positively acknowledge and recognize other colleagues, and uses personal experiences to model and teach Living PRIDE standards.
Exhibits tact and professionalism in difficult situations according to PRIDE Values and Practices
Demonstrates an understanding of and adheres to privacy, confidentiality, and security policies and procedures related to Protected Health Information (PHI) or other sensitive and personal information.
Demonstrates an understanding of and adheres to safety and infection control policies and procedures.
Assumes accountability for improving quality metrics associated with department/unit and meeting organizational/departmental targets.
Work Environment
Keeps working areas neat, orderly and clutter-free, including the hallways. Adheres to cleaning processes and puts things back where they belong. Removes and reports broken equipment and furniture.
Picks up and disposes of any litter found throughout entire facility.
Posts flyers and posters in designated areas only; does not post on walls, doors or windows.
Knows where the Environment of Care Manual is kept in department; corrects or reports unsafe conditions to the appropriate departments.
Protects the physical environment and equipment from damage and theft.
The flexibility to orient and work at all UCSF Medical Center locations is required.
Equal Employment Opportunity
The University of California San Francisco is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information. Further information about the University of California, San Francisco, is available at diversity.ucsf.edu. UCSF seeks candidates whose skills, and personal and professional experience, have prepared them to contribute to our commitment to diversity and excellence, and the communities we serve.

The Business Entity

We’re an agile, fun, passionate upstart culture within Cisco—balancing collaboration and integration with autonomy and innovation—to deliver the most effective solution to our customers’ problems. The unique mix of our disruptive approach to security and Cisco’s industry dominance surpasses what any other security startup could ever achieve on its own.

Who You'll Work With

The Business Intelligence Team is responsible for building our next-generation analytics platform to drive daily decision-making for our SaaS Internet Security business. We identify, craft, transform and combine data into readable, actionable and available reports for the entire business.

What You'll Do

Work closely with all BI team members, continually guiding and learning.

Facilitate and document business requirements gathering with leadership and key business partners.

Analyze and define information needs and reporting/analytical requirements across the organization and translate those needs into functional requirements.

Create architecture diagrams and systems documentation that can be understood and used by business users and IT.

Design and build dimensionally modeled data warehouse components and integrated BI solutions.

Design and build critical dashboards and reports, including ad-hoc and pre-defined content, that can be consumed daily by key stakeholders in the organization.

Partner with Business Operations to re-engineer business processes in order to make them more measurable and generate higher quality data.

Execute ad-hoc research, ranging from basic SQL queries to building more advanced analytical models.

Who You Are

BA/BS Degree (or equivalent) in a related discipline.

Strong interpersonal and writing skills.

8-10 years of practical development experience with dimensional modeling.

8-10 years in a business intelligence and/or data warehousing role.

8-10 years of validated business analysis experience.

8-10 years of experience with business process re-engineering and architecture.

Deep understanding of SQL and practical development experience with relational databases such as Snowflake (preferred), MySQL, etc.

Practical development experience with Tableau (preferred), Looker, Pentaho, or another similar BI platform.

Practical development experience with an integration tool such as Matillion (preferred), Talend, Kettle, Informatica, Boomi, SSIS, Mulesoft or similar.

Practical development experience writing Python to move and transform data sets.

Experience with data management and architecture including Meta and Master Data Management, hierarchy management and reference data.

Demonstrable understanding of core business processes including Finance, Marketing, Sales, and Customer Success in a SaaS or subscription-based organization.

Consistent record of data quality improvement.

Passionate about data, analytics, and automation.

Ability to quickly learn and acquire new job skills.

Bonus Skills

Strong preference for consulting background.

Experience administering AWS infrastructure.

Experience working at an internet security company.

Why Cisco

We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to shape the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with unique personalities who aren't afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns. We are thought leaders, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers. We Are Cisco.

Job Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, Corporate Strategy
Job Description:
At Unity, you'll make a difference. In a collaborative, fast-growing environment, we're democratizing development, solving hard problems, and enabling the success of our community.

Unity is looking for a Senior Business Intelligence ("BI") Analyst to join our FP&A Team. In this role, you will partner closely with finance teams and business leaders to drive the quality, speed, and actionability of our business insights and deepen the quality of our financial analytics and insight toolkit. You will have the opportunity to develop and build a new business intelligence led processes and systems that will rapidly deliver business insights to our leaders. This is a key role and will help ensure alignment on metrics across the company and drive key projects as we continue the rapid growth of our business across existing and new products and markets.

This role will report into our Senior Manager, Finance BI and Analytics team.

Responsibilities
Help evolve the vision, strategy, and implementation of business intelligence and analytics within Unity's Finance team
Lead organization wide initiatives to develop new processes, define business success, connect databases or alternative data sources for analysis, and streamline existing processes relating to financial reporting
Design, develop, and deliver insightful financial reports, KPIs, dashboards, and visual forward analyses for executive leadership decision making
Drive data-driven business decisions by providing actionable insight and analysis to multiple internal teams including Sales, Marketing, R&D, Customer Support, and Finance
Collaborate cross-functionally as the subject matter expert on business strategy and primary growth drivers to monitor and advise on the health of developed, nascent businesses, and address tough business issues
Provide in-depth analysis and commentary on financial performance and root cause variances to forecasts
Drive process improvement initiatives such as reporting automation/evolution and integrated forecasting/planning
Requirements
Prior experience in planning, business intelligence, data analytics, finance, accounting, strategy, and/or consulting functions
Strong understanding of efficient architecting, ETL, and documentation best practices with BigQuery/Data Studio, Looker, or other visualization tools. Ability to leverage our data pipeline to develop cadenced reports and drive bespoke analysis for Finance
Strong ability to quickly grasp business team goals/KPIs, provide analysis to drive success, work at all levels of the organization gathering requirements and communicating outputs, and translate data into insight, distilling complex trends and business drivers into actionable insight
Experience in SQL with ability to translate business needs and offline financial models into performant, scalable code
Proactive transformation of complex and ambiguous datasets to distill data into insight, create reports and analysis that tell the story behind the numbers to cross-functional business partners and executive leadership
Bonus Points
Data exploration and analysis experience using popular statistical packages such as R or Python
Experience in SaaS, video games, or technology
Adaptive Planning, Netsuite, and/or Workday
Who we are

Unity is the creator of the world's most widely-used real-time 3D (RT3D) development platform, providing content creators around the world with the tools they need to build rich, interactive 2D, 3D, VR and AR experiences. In fact, apps made with Unity reach 2.7 billion devices worldwide, and were installed more than 24 billion times in the last 12 months.

The global engineering team keeps Unity at the forefront of technology and — working alongside partners like Magic Leap, Google, Facebook, Oculus and Microsoft — ensures optimized support for the latest technology and platforms. Unity is powering the real-time revolution, expanding beyond games and breaking into other industries including automotive, film, architecture, engineering, construction and more.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

Job Description:
Named as a Forbes Fintech 50 in 2019, Marqeta powers modern payment solutions for companies innovating new services and process flows in a digital world. Our platform, open API, and advanced analytics provide unprecedented control for companies to issue cards, authorize transactions and manage payment operations in real-time.

We are a team of industry experts and technology innovators who take a dynamic approach to solving challenging problems. We power possibilities for our customers by bringing the best talent together in an open and collaborative work environment that rewards creativity and perseverance.

Marqeta is proud of its Oakland roots and strives to build a global team as diverse as the markets we serve, staying true to our values to Connect the Customer, Find a Way, Make Simple, Take Risk and Build One Marqeta. We are not expecting any single candidate to meet all job requirements listed below, so please apply. It's an exciting time to join Marqeta. As we grow, your career and opportunities will grow as well.

Position Summary


The Customer Success (CS) team is seeking an individual proficient in data analysis, design and building scalable solutions to deliver insights on customer performance, revenue drivers, and CS operations. Your work will be both customer-facing, as well as for the CS team internally.

Our Team's Role
Strategic partners to protect and grow customers: Customer Success builds deep partnerships with our customers to ensure Marqeta's platform supports their growth. Robust data insights are critical to this effort.
Understand & evangelize the customer experience: As we work with cross-functional teams, we convey the voice of a diverse array of customers throughout the organization so that our products and features meet their demands. Your work in particular will complement the voice of the customer using metrics and data validation.
Primary Responsibilities


You will research and analyze data patterns to optimize our customers' growth. You'll create dashboards, reports, and alerts to provide internal stakeholders with actionable insights. You'll build tracking and monitoring to help the team stay ahead of merchant-specific trends, interchange rate changes, and anomalies in customer program behaviors. Your work will influence customer forecasting and annual projections, and you'll have the opportunity to deliver data insights directly to customers.

The right person for this role has a passion for learning, analytical problem solving, and a curiosity for all things data. At the same time, you should possess a revenue-focused mentality and desire to deliver impactful knowledge to drive growth. Self-motivation and good communication are both key skills. You should be comfortable working in a startup environment with shifting priorities, vague requirements, and rapid iterations where we want you to take risks.

Requirements
History of designing, building and launching efficient & reliable data solutions, ideally with a non-technical end-user in mind (preferably with APIs)
Deep background with Python
Familiarity with a cloud based data warehouse such as Redshift, BigQuery, or Snowflake
Experience with git, Github, and the pull request workflow
Experience with financial transaction data and/or user spending behavior data
Experience working with teams to creatively solve complex data-related problems
Positive outlook towards work, strong work ethic and ability to work in a team environment
Ability to partner and collaborate across multiple teams
Bonus Points for:
Experience with APIs
Experience building customer facing data solutions (such as through Tableau)
Experience in payments (good domain knowledge on financial services industry)
History building data science or analytic products
Experience in large data environments
Experience with Amazon Redshift, Redis/Elasticache, Snowflake, and S3
Experience with CI/CD such as Drone
Experience with Kubernetes, Docker, and Airflow

Pet insurance
401k plan with a Company match
Competitive pay

Recent years have made us all too familiar with the destruction that natural disasters can bring about, and the increasing frequency and intensity with which they are occurring. Every year we are faced with the devastation and harsh impact that wildfires, hurricanes, and floods have on millions of lives. Despite mounting losses, conventional methods of risk modeling at best paint an incomplete picture of these threats, and at worst, get them completely wrong. Better outcomes require better preparedness. Better preparedness requires better modeling, which requires better data and better approaches to working with that data.

Zesty.ai uses novel data gathering and machine learning approaches to produce higher quality information about the risks to property from catastrophes like floods and wildfires. While AI alone may not be able to thwart these disasters, it can help us be more prepared for them, and ultimately that will lead to better outcomes.

We have partnered with leading insurance carriers and reinsurers to underwrite risk more accurately, provide customers a smoother purchasing experience and manage inspections more cost-effectively.

As a Senior Data Engineer, you have strong interest/experience working with remote sensing and imagery. You will be building the platform that delivers processed data and imagery to our machine learning systems. You will be doing advanced imagery manipulation and GIS processing. You thrive in a collaborative, creative environment that moves fast and are comfortable learning new skills and working with unfamiliar technologies.

Are you ready to help us change the world?

Working on data cleansing, batch processing, data transformations, and other data manipulations to enable our data science efforts
Advanced image manipulation
Geometry/geographic calculations
Serving as part of the core team for the technology stack
Partnering closely with the Founders to bring a disruptive AI based technology platform to the insurance and real estate markets
Investigating and prototyping new technologies

Bachelor’s Degree is required

Expert working with cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud, etc)
Experience with Airflow or other workflow management software
Ability to define data model and data storage strategies, including knowledge of distributed data systems
Ability to manage multiple/competing priorities and make the right tradeoffs and timely delivery of features
Experience or familiarity with geography, geometry and GIS systems
Experience working with satellite/remote imagery
Relevant education (Coding Bootcamp, and/or Bachelors in Computer Science) or equivalent experience
Must be legally eligible to work in the U.S.

This will involve intimate collaboration with Scientists, Laboratory Automation Engineers and Product Development Teams within the function and across the Roche network.

Work with our Technical Development Scientists and Directors to understand business needs and priorities, as well as clearly communicate scope and progress of work.
Translate user requests into functional and technical requirements for data management and software tools

Excellent verbal and written business communication skills
Experience promoting software development best practices with colleagues
Demonstrated ability to understand complex scientific requirements to effectively communicate with users, understand their work, and translate requirements into solutions including Agile development environments.

Comfortable working in a scientific environment, especially one that is related to drug development.

Earnest empowers people with the financial capital they need to live better lives.

We use technology, data, and design to:
Build more affordable products
Deliver them to more people
Engage through more human experiences
As a Senior Data Engineer, you will report to the Head of Data and work closely with other members of the Data team to maintain and improve data pipelines, deploy predictive models as a service, and work on our data infrastructure.

Team Philosophy:
We believe that data engineers should not write ETL, unless data pipelines are necessary to support the services that we build and maintain. Instead, your time is better spent writing tooling and creating abstractions to support the work of analysts and data scientists on the team, so that other users in the company can write and maintain their own ETL.
Everyone on the team is considered and treated as a Senior, so you are given a lot of ownership over the projects you're working on. With this in mind, we expect you to write code that is well tested, modular, and maintainable. We frown at instances of destructive fire fighting, caused by badly designed architecture or mismanaged projects.
We like learners. Hence, we create an environment where Data Scientists learn the skills and abstraction patterns of Software Engineers and Data Engineers learn the iterative model development workflow seen in Machine Learning. Expect an environment where you will be constantly learning and challenged to interact with tools, languages, frameworks that are outside of your area of expertise.
Tools, Frameworks, and Languages you will work with:
Languages: Python, Scala, and occasionally R and Node.js
Storage: Postgres, Redshift, S3
Compute: Spark, Athena, EC2
Workflow Management: Airflow
Infrastructure: Terraform, Kubernetes
Potential Projects:
Deploy trained machine learning models as a Python microservice.
Help migrate legacy ETLs into Airflow
Write tooling to make ETL accessible to engineers on other teams.
Ideal background and expertise:
5+ years of experience as a full-time professional data engineer
Experience with server-side concepts, e.g. microservices, database, caching, performance, monitoring and scalability
3+ years of experience with Python or Scala
Working experience with OLTP databases such as Postgres, MySQL
Extensive experience making data available in OLAP databases such as Redshift or Snowflake
Experience with orchestration tools such as Airflow (preferred), Luigi, Ooozie
Nice to Have:
Familiarity with Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau, Looker, Superset
Domain experience developing software for Fintech, Banking, or related Consumer Financial Services companies
Earnest Perks & Benefits:
Health, Dental, & Vision benefits plus savings plans
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
401(k) plan to help you save for retirement plus a company match
Tuition reimbursement program
$1000 flight on each Earnie-versary to anywhere in the world and 25 days of annual PTO
